org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa
Class SemanticDeterminism

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.AbstractAlgorithm
      org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.fsa.SemanticDeterminism
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, Algorithm, AlgorithmListener
public class SemanticDeterminism
extends AbstractAlgorithm

This class provides tests if an automaton is semantically deterministic, i.e. DBW-recognizable, based on the approach in [Lawrence H. Landweber: Decision Problems for Omega-Automata. Mathematical Systems Theory 3(4): 376-384 (1969)].

Author:
Yi-Wen Chang, ported by Ming-Hsien Tsai

SemanticDeterminism

public SemanticDeterminism()
Method Detail

isSemanticallyDeterministic

public boolean isSemanticallyDeterministic(FSA aut)
Returns true if a specified automaton is semantically deterministic, that is, equivalent to some deterministic Büchi automaton. The automaton is first converted to an equivalent NBW. The NBW is then determinized to an equivalent DRW. An equivalent DMW is obtained from the DRW. Finally, the DMW tested to see if it is semantically deterministic.

Parameters:
aut - an automaton to be checked
Returns:
true if aut is determinable to an equivalent deterministic Büchi automaton
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if aut cannot be converted to an NBW
Created by:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

isDMWDeterminableToDBW

public boolean isDMWDeterminableToDBW(FSA muller)
Returns true if a DMW is equivalent to some DBW.

Parameters:
muller - a DMW
Returns:
true if muller is equivalent to some DBW
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if muller is not a DMW
